subject: Re: Website updates/changes please and thank you
preview: Thanks so much Chris.  Get Outlook for iOS

full_threads.body:
Thanks so much Chris.

Get Outlook for iOS
+30mins to complete content updates. Total of 2 hours were added to harvest and closed.

Hi Alicia, 

Confirming the updates have been completed: 
https://dontsweatit.com.au/buzz/
https://dontsweatit.com.au/
https://dontsweatit.com.au/workplace-peri-and-menopause-course/
https://dontsweatit.com.au/peri-and-menopause-webinars-and-workshops/
https://dontsweatit.com.au/peri-and-menopause-services/

The updates took us 2 hours and were completed in the included support hours for April. 

Please review and let us know of any further changes.

Thanks @glen, looking great. Here is the next part:

Can we please have ALL of the logos that are being used on the buzz page https://dontsweatit.com.au/buzz/ from the section of "organisations we have worked with" to be added in a grid like formation to the homepage https://dontsweatit.com.au. 

The grid of logos to be set up in a grid format (not rolling just permanently being shown) to sit between the sections "Why you need it, now!" and "What makes us so special?"

I estimate we'll be able to complete the above in under an hour, what do you think?

action.text: Glen Tenorio assigned to Glen Tenorio

please let me know once this task is complete, the client would like to split this over April May support hours.

+20 mins chris.

action.text: Glen Tenorio assigned to Chris Paradowski

full_threads.body:
Hi Chris,

I have some additions /changes to make to the website (quite a few content changes/updates). If the time these changes is going to go over our allocated time for April, please leave whatever is outstanding to complete in May instead as not super urgent.


  1. I have uploaded some additional logos (yesterday to the dropbox document which you sent me a while ago). Can you please add these new logos to the buzz page logo's section of organisations we have worked with.

Also in that section if we could please increase the speed of the rolling logos.


  1. Can we please have ALL of the logos that are being used on the buzz page https://dontsweatit.com.au/buzz/ from the section of "organisations we have worked with" to be added in a grid like formation to the homepage. The grid of logos to be set up in a grid format (not rolling just permanently being shown)

https://dontsweatit.com.au to sit between the sections "Why you need it, now!" and "What makes us so special?"



  1. Changes to copy on current pages:

https://dontsweatit.com.au/workplace-peri-and-menopause-course/

Can we change Optional extras

If bells and whistles get you going, take your pick from our range of extras. Choose one, or hell, choose them all!

Change to

Optional extras

If you are interested in our other services, we can offer;

Also on same page can we please change

45 minute webinar with Dr Ginni and Shelly. We'll bring the love into the Zoom and answer staff questions.

In-person event with Dr Ginni and Shelly. Yep we'll come to your office. Can't promise high kicks but we will do jazz hands if you have good coffee.

Need a peri and menopause policy at work? Dr Ginni and Shelly can provide input and a bit of polish!

If you have specific questions for your workplace we can tailor a webinar or event to meet your needs.

Change To

1 hour webinar or in person presentation with Dr Ginni and Shelly. We have a range of customizable webinars including presentation and time for questions.

A peri and menopause policy at work. The most up to date, best practice consulting and advice.

Establishment of menopause peer to peer networks and menopause mentor training

Menopause specific executive health checks

Conferences and special events

ALSO ON THE SAME PAGE

At the bottom of this page I can't copy and paste but old text = Her's a stat to flabber your gast

REPLACE ALL TEXT IN THE PURPLE BOX TO:

Why your workplace needs to address peri and menopause

Women of typical menopausal age are the fastest growing demographic in the workplace. Most women will experience symptoms that directly impact their ability to perform at work.

UK research shows that 10% women with peri- and menopause symptoms leave the workforce altogether. Twice as many consider it. These are women who are at the peak of their experience and earning potential.

The same UK data suggests that of those who stay on in their job, 14% reduce their hours or work part time and 8% either avoid a promotion or actively ask for a demotion.

Research from Australia shows the worse the peri- and menopause-related symptoms, the less engaged women feel at work, the less satisfied with their job, the greater their intention to quit their job and the lower their commitment to the organisation.

Interested in finding out more? Get in touch (click through to info@dontsweatit.com.au)

  1. https://dontsweatit.com.au/peri-and-menopause-webinars-and-workshops/

CAN YOU PLEASE CHANGE THE LENGTH OF TIME FOR EACH OF THE WEBINAR SUMMARY'S (which is the last bullet point for each of the webinar descriptors) so that they no longer say they are 30 minutes long… .instead the last bullet point should be

  • 1 Hour session which includes 15 minutes for Q&A - both live and pre-submitted anonymous

Also can you please add this webinar descriptor below and make this the webinar listed as number 1 and then adjust the numbers of the webinars below that so the last webinar called caring for your skin in midlife should be number 10.

  1. Menopause at Work Basics

What is menopause? How is it different to perimenopause?

What happens to women as they go through menopause? How long does it last? How does affect them at work?

Can it be helped?

How can workplaces help?

1 hour session which included 15 minutes for Q&A - both live and pre-submitted anonymous


  1. https://dontsweatit.com.au/peri-and-menopause-services/

For the bottom of the dropdown list How can I make my workplace more peri and menopause friendly

can text

How can I make my workplace more Peri and menopause friendly?

  1. Have a specific menopause workplace policy. Having a specific menopause in the workplace policy re-enforces the organisation's commitment to acknowledging that menopause is a workplace issue. Don't Sweat It can help you develop your menopause policy.
  2. Raise awareness. It is critically important to raise awareness among the entire workforce of any organisation, including senior management and supervisors. This is critical to removing stigma and to encouraging women to seek help and support. Menopause specific workplace education programs should educate workers about how to have sensitive conversations about menopause with their colleagues at work.
  3. Have a menopause friendly physical environment. Access to fans, temperature control, cool water, sanitary products in the bathrooms and easy access to bathrooms will improve conditions for women with the symptoms of peri and menopause. Where possible allow symptomatic women to work from home.
  4. Have menopause champions. We know women want support in their workplaces. Having support people, champions, Slack or Teams group chats, opportunities to attend webinars and off site learning sessions can help women feel their workplace is part of the solution- not the problem. Don't Sweat It can provide webinars, Lunch and Learns and even off site meetings for your organisation.

Be replaced with

How can I make my workplace more Peri and menopause friendly?

  1. Have a specific menopause workplace policy. Having a specific menopause in the workplace policy re-enforces the organisation's commitment to acknowledging that menopause is a workplace issue. Don't Sweat It can help you develop your menopause policy.
  2. Raise awareness. It is critically important to raise awareness among the entire workforce of any organisation, including senior management and supervisors. This is critical to removing stigma and to encouraging women to seek help and support. Menopause specific workplace education programs should educate workers about how to have sensitive conversations about menopause with their colleagues at work.
  3. Have a menopause friendly physical environment. Access to fans, temperature control, cool water, sanitary products in the bathrooms and easy access to bathrooms will improve conditions for women with the symptoms of peri and menopause. Where possible allow symptomatic women to work from home.
  4. Have menopause mentors inside peer to peer workplace based networking groups. We know women want support in their workplaces. Having support people, mentors, Slack, Yammer or Teams group chats, opportunities to attend webinars and off site learning sessions can help women feel their workplace is part of the solution- not the problem. Don't Sweat It can provide webinars, Lunch and Learns and even off-site meetings for your organisation.


I think that's it for the moment. Please let me know if you have any questions. There are quite a few amendments and I have no idea how much time it takes to make these so please just stick within the allocated time that we have for the month and roll over anything that hasn't been able to fit into the timeframe over to work for May.

I will be going on leave from tomorrow afternoon and returning on 29th April but I will have access to emails so I can respond if any of the above isn't clear.

Thanks so much for your help.

Many thanks

Alicia
